content: I have started a refactor of Bochner integral, so that âˆ« x in a..b, f makes sense when, say, f is continuous on [a, b] but possibly not globally measurable. The idea is to define the integral for all functions that coincide almost everywhere with a measurable function (i.e., which are measurable for the completed measure). It is a little bit painful, but I think it is definitely worth it. It is not building yet, but I'm already sharing it since I won't have time to work on it in the next few days -- maybe @Yury G. Kudryashov or @Floris van Doorn will want to have a look and share some thoughts!
This is indeed worth it! This had to be done at some point, so it's great that you started on this.
